title: Make Soap from Animal Fat and Ashes
brief: Create soap for hygiene when commercial soap is unavailable using animal fat and wood ashes.
steps: Step 1: Cut animal fat into small pieces and cook slowly in a pot, stirring frequently.
Step 2: Add enough water to prevent fat from sticking as it renders.
Step 3: Pour the rendered grease into a container to harden.
Step 4: Place wood ashes in a container with a spout near the bottom.
Step 5: Pour water over ashes and collect the liquid (lye) that drips from the spout.
Step 6: Mix 2 parts grease to 1 part lye in a cooking pot.
Step 7: Boil the mixture over fire until it thickens.
Step 8: Use immediately as semi-liquid soap or pour into pan to harden for bars.
warnings: Lye is caustic - avoid getting it on skin or in eyes.
Test soap on small skin area first to check for irritation.
